p: Coronaviruses have a large (30+ kb) single-stranded positive sense RNA genome encased by a helical nucleocapsid (N) and an outer envelope comprised of matrix protein (M), envelope protein (E) and spike proteins (S) [22]. The S protein, which naturally occurs in a trimeric form, contains the receptor-binding domain (RBD) responsible for binding onto the angiotensin converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) and entry into the cell ( Figure 1 ). In SARS-CoV, of all the structural proteins, S protein was found to elicit neutralising antibody and is a major target antigen for vaccine development [23], [24].
